title: 8.5.2 Implement YAML loading for compliance frameworks
body:
## Parent Issue
#39 - 8.5 Knowledge Base Integration

## Objective
Load compliance framework data from YAML files (HIPAA, SOC2, PCI-DSS, GDPR, CIS, NIST).

## Implementation

```python
# src/ib_platform/kb/loader.py
import yaml
from pathlib import Path

class KBLoader:
    """Load KB data from YAML files."""

    def __init__(self, data_dir: Path):
        self.data_dir = data_dir

    async def load_frameworks(self) -> dict[str, list[ComplianceControl]]:
        """Load all compliance frameworks."""
        frameworks = {}
        frameworks_dir = self.data_dir / "frameworks"

        for framework_dir in frameworks_dir.iterdir():
            if framework_dir.is_dir():
                controls_file = framework_dir / "controls.yaml"
                if controls_file.exists():
                    data = yaml.safe_load(controls_file.read_text())
                    framework = data["framework"]
                    frameworks[framework] = [
                        ComplianceControl(
                            framework=framework,
                            **control
                        )
                        for control in data.get("controls", [])
                    ]

        return frameworks
```

## Sample Data Structure

```yaml
# data/compliance/frameworks/hipaa/controls.yaml
framework: HIPAA
version: "2013"
controls:
  - control_id: "164.312(a)(1)"
    name: Access Control
    description: |
      Implement technical policies and procedures for electronic information
      systems that maintain ePHI to allow access only to authorized persons.
    requirements:
      - Unique User Identification
      - Emergency Access Procedure
      - Automatic Logoff
      - Encryption and Decryption
    aws_services:
      - IAM
      - KMS
      - S3
      - RDS
    implementation_guidance: |
      1. Use IAM for user authentication and authorization
      2. Implement MFA for all users with ePHI access
      3. Enable CloudTrail for access logging
```

- [ ] Controls parsed from YAML correctly
- [ ] Framework version tracked
- [ ] AWS services mapped to controls

- [ ] Unit tests for loader
